drive_tip:
Select a drive to wipe or verify.
Be aware that the entire physical drive
will be wiped, not just a partition.
value_tip:
Select the byte value to overwrite with (or to verify).
Hexadecimal notation is used.
blocksize_tip:
Select the block size for reading and writing.
For SSDs this should match the size of a
memory page (4096 bytes usually works well).
maxbadblocks_tip:
Select the maximum number of bad
blocks before aborting the process.
maxretries_tip:
Select the maximum number of retries
for failed read or write operations
before considered bad block.
label: Volume label
label_tip:
Enter the volume label if you want
to format the wiped drive
task_tip:
Select the wipe method (or just verify).
The first option is designed for SSDs.
Every block (or memory page) is checked
and will only be overwritten if data is present.
create_tip:
Select partition table to create after wiping.
'Create GPT partition table' uses the modern standard.
'Create MBR partition table' is a legacy method for
drives up to 3TB maximum.
fs_tip:
Choose file system for the new partition.
NTFS is the Windows standard file system.
exFAT works for most other operating systems.
FAT32 is a legacy file system and might be a
good choice for SD cards or smaller USB drives.
wipe_tip:
Select a drive in the field above and
start the wipe or verification process.
shutdown_tip:
Shut down the computer when
the wipe process is complete.
quit_tip:
Exit the application, abort any running
wiping or verification process.
abort_warning:
Process is running!
Do you want to abort and exit the application?
